SUMMARY: REQUIRED | OPTIONAL DETAIL: ELEMENT

self.philbrown.AbLE.annotations
Annotation Type XMLLayout

@Target(value=TYPE)
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface XMLLayout

Defines a layout that is inflated from XML

Author:
Phil Brown

Required Element Summary
 java.lang.String resourceID
          Set this to the name of the layout in res/layout.
 
Optional Element Summary
 ORIENTATION[] orientation
          Set the orientation.
 float[] origin
          Set to the x and y coordinates of the inflated View, respectively.
 java.lang.String[] params
          Layout Parameters.
 

Element Detail

resourceID

public abstract java.lang.String resourceID
Set this to the name of the layout in res/layout. For example for res/layout/main.xml, use "main".

Returns:

origin

public abstract float[] origin
Set to the x and y coordinates of the inflated View, respectively.

Returns:
Default:
{0.0f, 0.0f}

params

public abstract java.lang.String[] params
Layout Parameters. Can be any of "fill_parent", "wrap_content", "match_parent", or a pixel value.

Returns:
See Also:
android.view.ViewGroup.LayoutParams LayoutParams}
Default:
{"wrap_content", "wrap_content"}

orientation

public abstract ORIENTATION[] orientation
Set the orientation. This is only used for top-level layouts.
To match Android defaults, all orientations are enabled by default

Returns:
Default:
{self.philbrown.AbLE.annotations.ORIENTATION.portrait, self.philbrown.AbLE.annotations.ORIENTATION.portraitUpsideDown, self.philbrown.AbLE.annotations.ORIENTATION.landscapeLeft, self.philbrown.AbLE.annotations.ORIENTATION.landscapeRight}
